benchmark_details.name: Mathematical Topics Tree (MaTT)
benchmark_details.overview: The MaTT benchmark is a challenging and structured benchmark that offers 1,958 questions across a wide array of mathematical subjects, each paired with a detailed hierarchical chain of topics to evaluate the mathematical reasoning capabilities of large language models (LLMs).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation of the mathematical reasoning capabilities of LLMs.

data.source: Extracted questions from reference books and curated under a detailed topical tree.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the percentage of correct answers provided by LLMs on the MaTT benchmark.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better mathematical reasoning capabilities of LLMs.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4 achieved 54% accuracy in multiple-choice format.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated through manual checks on the question-answer pairs.
